content: Breadsplaining but not trying to sound snooty: A baguette is a specific type of bread, per width and length. It has a crisp crust and lots of air pockets. From your photo, it looks like your bread is sort of “imitation baguette,” i.e. what is called in the U.S. Italian or French bread. Again, I can only base this on the picture, but I am assuming it does not have a super crisp crust nor many air pockets within.
